instructions.description: What should this LLM node do.

isGlobal.description: If true, this node will be always present for the LLM

toolsIds.description: The tools that will be available for this node

condition.description: The condition that will be checked to determine if the node should advanced to the selected node id or not or should simply loop in the current node.

childrenNodes.description: The outputs of this node which the node after finishing will choose from to either advance or to keep looping in this node till it caputures or reaches one of the mentioned routers.

maxTokens.description: The max tokens of the LLM
The max tokens of the LLM

toolUseBias.description: The bias of the LLM to use tools if 0 it will never use tools, if 1 it will only use tools.

enabled.description: If true, the LLM will try to detect if the user has changed his mind about something enabling the AI to rewind back to the previous node.

level.description: The level of rewinding, if 1 the LLM will have access to only 1 level or rewind capabilities meaning if it went from node A > B > C > D  then if it at node d & it detects it needs to be at node B again it will be able to rewind back to node B if the level is at least 2, it will not be able to detect node A unless the level is 3 or more, and so on.

type.description: The type of the node, if not provided it will be a normal LLM node.

name.description: The name of the tool, providing a human-readable identifier for display purposes.

disabled.description: Indicates whether the tool is currently disabled. A disabled tool cannot be used by the agent.

isGlobal.description: If true, this tool is globally accessible to all nodes and agents. Overrides context-specific restrictions.

id.description: A unique identifier for the field, ensuring it is distinct across the system.

in.description: Defines the location or context in which the field is utilized. Common values include 'query', 'body', or 'header'.

type.description: Specifies the variable type of the field. Acceptable values include 'string', 'number', 'boolean', and 'system'.

value.description: The current assigned value of the field. This value is optional and supports any type depending on the field's context.

defaultValue.description: A predefined value assigned to the field when no specific value is provided. Useful for ensuring consistent behavior.

key.description: The unique key that identifies this tool field or variable. Often used for referencing the field programmatically.

description.description: A detailed explanation of the field's purpose and usage. Helps users understand the field's role in the system.

required.description: Indicates whether the presence of this field is mandatory for successful operation. Defaults to false if unspecified.

reusable.description: Denotes whether this field can be reused across multiple contexts or tools. Useful for reducing redundancy.

isEnv.description: Specifies if this field represents an environment variable, typically used for configuration or deployment.

isSystem.description: Indicates whether this field is a system-level variable, reserved for core operations or internal use.

isGlobal.description: If enabled, this field remains globally accessible to the agent across all operational contexts. Useful for global constants.

userId.description: References the unique identifier of the user associated with this field. Useful for user-specific customizations.

enabled.description: If true, the LLM will try to detect if the user has changed his mind about something enabling the AI to rewind back to the previous node.

level.description: The level of rewinding, if 1 the LLM will have access to only 1 level or rewind capabilities meaning if it went from node A > B > C > D  then if it at node d & it detects it needs to be at node B again it will be able to rewind back to node B if the level is at least 2, it will not be able to detect node A unless the level is 3 or more, and so on.

description.description: A short description of what this node does and when it should be used, specially useful if the node is global or when the LLM detects automatic rerouting.

instructions.description: What should this LLM node do.

isGlobal.description: If true, this node will be always present for the LLM

toolsIds.description: The tools that will be available for this node

condition.description: The condition that will be checked to determine if the node should advanced to the selected node id or not or should simply loop in the current node.

childrenNodes.description: The outputs of this node which the node after finishing will choose from to either advance or to keep looping in this node till it caputures or reaches one of the mentioned routers.

maxTokens.description: The max tokens of the LLM
The max tokens of the LLM

routerLlmConfig.description: The LLM config that will be used for the router node, NOTE: This must be a fast LLM model or the latency will be too high between responses.

toolUseBias.description: The bias of the LLM to use tools if 0 it will never use tools, if 1 it will only use tools.

enabled.description: If true, the LLM will try to detect if the user has changed his mind about something enabling the AI to rewind back to the previous node.

level.description: The level of rewinding, if 1 the LLM will have access to only 1 level or rewind capabilities meaning if it went from node A > B > C > D  then if it at node d & it detects it needs to be at node B again it will be able to rewind back to node B if the level is at least 2, it will not be able to detect node A unless the level is 3 or more, and so on.

smartSearch.description: If true, the LLM will use the smart search to search through the docs.

defaultValue.description: A predefined value assigned to the field when no specific value is provided. Useful for ensuring consistent behavior.

key.description: The unique key that identifies this tool field or variable. Often used for referencing the field programmatically.

description.description: A detailed explanation of the field's purpose and usage. Helps users understand the field's role in the system.

required.description: Indicates whether the presence of this field is mandatory for successful operation. Defaults to false if unspecified.

reusable.description: Denotes whether this field can be reused across multiple contexts or tools. Useful for reducing redundancy.

isEnv.description: Specifies if this field represents an environment variable, typically used for configuration or deployment.

isSystem.description: Indicates whether this field is a system-level variable, reserved for core operations or internal use.

isGlobal.description: If enabled, this field remains globally accessible to the agent across all operational contexts. Useful for global constants.

agentId.description: References the unique identifier of the agent associated with this field. Helps in mapping fields to specific agents.

userId.description: References the unique identifier of the user associated with this field. Useful for user-specific customizations.

description.description: A short description of what this node does and when it should be used, specially useful if the node is global or when the LLM detects automatic rerouting.

instructions.description: What should this LLM node do.

isGlobal.description: If true, this node will be always present for the LLM

toolsIds.description: The tools that will be available for this node

condition.description: The condition that will be checked to determine if the node should advanced to the selected node id or not or should simply loop in the current node.

childrenNodes.description: The outputs of this node which the node after finishing will choose from to either advance or to keep looping in this node till it caputures or reaches one of the mentioned routers.

maxTokens.description: The max tokens of the LLM
The max tokens of the LLM

routerLlmConfig.description: The LLM config that will be used for the router node, NOTE: This must be a fast LLM model or the latency will be too high between responses.

toolUseBias.description: The bias of the LLM to use tools if 0 it will never use tools, if 1 it will only use tools.

enabled.description: If true, the LLM will try to detect if the user has changed his mind about something enabling the AI to rewind back to the previous node.

level.description: The level of rewinding, if 1 the LLM will have access to only 1 level or rewind capabilities meaning if it went from node A > B > C > D  then if it at node d & it detects it needs to be at node B again it will be able to rewind back to node B if the level is at least 2, it will not be able to detect node A unless the level is 3 or more, and so on.

autoRerouter.description: The auto rerouter of this node.

type.description: The type of the node, if not provided it will be a normal LLM node.

rf.description: The position of the node in the reactflow canvas.

maxChunks.description: The max chunks to use from the KB.

tags.description: The tags to use to filter the docs we search through

smartSearch.description: If true, the LLM will use the smart search to search through the docs.

items.description: A node in the LLM chain.

appendBeforePrompt.description: The prompt to append to the nodes' prompt.

maxTokens.description: The max tokens of the LLM
The max tokens of the LLM

backchannelOnChoosingNodes.description: If true, the LLM will say uha/i see before choosing a node.

enableUiEngine.description: If true, the LLM will be able to show buttons, cards, images on text channels only.

isDefault.description: Indicates whether this tool is the default tool for the agent. Defaults to false if unspecified.

method.description: The HTTP method used by this tool. Acceptable values are 'GET', 'POST', 'PUT', or 'PATCH'. Defaults to 'POST' if unspecified.

name.description: The name of the tool, providing a human-readable identifier for display purposes.

description.description: A detailed description of the tool's purpose and functionality. Helps users understand its role within the agent.

serverUrl.description: The server URL where the tool's operations are performed. Used for network-based integrations.

serverUrlSecret.description: A secret token or key associated with the server URL. Provides secure access to the tool's backend services.

disabled.description: Indicates whether the tool is currently disabled. A disabled tool cannot be used by the agent.

isVapiTool.description: Indicates whether the tool is a Virtual API (VAPI) tool. VAPI tools enable interaction with external APIs.

vapiId.description: A unique identifier for the VAPI associated with this tool. Used for integration with specific API endpoints.

isGlobal.description: If true, this tool is globally accessible to all nodes and agents. Overrides context-specific restrictions.
